parts.instructions: Answer the questions below. Use NO MORE THAN THREE WORDS AND/OR A NUMBER.

questions.prompt: In what month is Katherine’s birthday?
What is Katherine’s last name?
At what time would Katherine like the party to start?
What activity is not available on the chosen date?
How many people will Katherine invite to the party?

parts.instructions: Use NO MORE THAN THREE WORDS AND/OR A NUMBER from the listening for each answer.

questions.prompt: Opening Times: Saturday & Sunday: 8:30 a.m. - ________
Activities: Boat Tour: ________ per person
Activities: Baking (15 people max): ________ per person
Food & Drinks: Large Buffet: ________
Staying Overnight: Tree House: ________ (20 people)

parts.instructions: Answer the questions 11–20. Use the correct format (letters for map, multiple choice, or select four options).

questions.prompt: Town Museum
Main Town Mosque
War Memorial Fountain
Barton Shopping Centre
For how long does Sharon estimate her walking tour of the town will last?
How much does Sharon charge for her walking tour of the town?
What FOUR things does Sharon say people can do that evening in Barton?
options: D. Going on a tour of the town’s theatre
E. Watching a play at the town’s theatre
F. Taking part in a quiz
G. Watching some theatre performed in the town square

parts.instructions: Complete the sentences below. Use NO MORE THAN THREE WORDS AND/OR A NUMBER.

questions.prompt: Steve's Notes: Steve interacted with ________ to gather his data.
Steve's Notes: Steve had to rent a ________ himself to gather data on growth with parasites.
Simone's Project: A study of ________ for different tomato varieties.
Robert's Project: Initially wanted to examine how the ________ of soil affects plant growth, but due to a late start he switched to the growing techniques used by apple farmers.
Robert's Notes: The apple project had better success due to the later ________.
Projects MUST be submitted as a ________ to Professor Evans by the 28th February.
Projects must be emailed to Mrs. Roberts by the ________.
Word limit is increased this year by ________ words.
(now 10,000, not including ________).
Prof. Evans’ advice should stop projects from failing, but if they aren’t good enough, the failing student will not ________.

parts.instructions: Choose the correct option or complete the sentences below.

questions.prompt: The Rorschach Test was initially based on
options: A) how schizophrenics see things differently.
C) observation of the schizophrenic child of a well-known psychologist.

questions.prompt: The Rorschach Test uses
options: A) a unique method in how it assesses people.
B) a common method to assess people.
C) a method that is nowadays very infrequently administered to assess people.

questions.prompt: The Rorschach ink blots are
options: A) first shown to subjects the day before the test.
B) first shown to subjects an hour before the test.
C) not supposed to be ever made public before the test.

questions.prompt: The accuracy of the Rorschach Test
options: A) has been demonstrated through careful experimentation.
C) is widely used in the United States.

questions.prompt: Interpretation of the Rorschach Test’s results
options: A) is still disputed among psychologists and psychiatrists using the test.
B) is now universally done using the Exner Comprehensive System.
C) are often confirmed using modern personality tests.

parts.instructions: Complete the sentences below. Use NO MORE THAN TWO WORDS from the listening for each answer.

questions.prompt: In the Exner Comprehensive System, the structural summary results are meant to demonstrate ________ associated with different responses given.
The rigidity of method used when delivering the Rorschach Test is supposed to keep ________ in results to a minimum.
The person delivering the Rorschach Test will rarely provide any ________ to the test taker.
Nowadays, the tests are recorded, but in the past, a particular ________ was created for people to write notes during the Rorschach Test.
Efforts are made to stop test takers becoming ________ or distracted, as this can create unreliable results.
